title: 115_hr1671
content: The "Verify First Act" requires individuals to provide their Social Security Number in order to receive the health insurance premium tax credit. The "Verify First Act" mandates the inclusion of an individual's Social Security Number to qualify for the health insurance premium tax credit under Section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code. No premium or advance payment of the credit will be considered without the taxpayer's inclusion of the individual's social security number on their tax return. The "Verify First Act" requires verification of an individual's social security number by the Secretary, in consultation with the Commissioner of Social Security and the Secretary of Homeland Security, to qualify for the health insurance premium tax credit. The "Verify First Act" mandates the inclusion of an individual's social security number on tax returns to qualify for the health insurance premium tax credit. No credit will be given without this requirement, and no advance payments will be made without the necessary verification. The "Verify First Act" requires individuals to provide their social security number on tax returns to qualify for the health insurance premium tax credit. Verification by the Secretary, in consultation with the Commissioner of Social Security and the Secretary of Homeland Security, is necessary. Failure to provide the correct social security number will result in the omission of the tax credit. The amendment requires individuals to provide their correct social security number on tax returns to qualify for the health insurance premium tax credit. Failure to do so will result in the omission of the tax credit for taxable years ending after a specified date. The amendment made by the Act applies to taxable years ending after its enactment. It also includes provisions for advance payment, new health insurance premium tax credit, and treatment as mathematical or clerical errors for taxable years ending after the enactment date.
